passage_text: 1 of 8. 8 photos: Photos: Forbes' highest-paid actresses. Forbes' highest-paid actresses – No. 2: The Hunger Games actress Jennifer Lawrence earned $34 million between June 2013 and June 2014 -- not so surprising considering the star's tireless work ethic.

Sandra Bullock arrives at the Oscars in March 2014. Sandra Bullock's earnings defied gravity this year. The 50-year-old Bullock is Hollywood's highest paid actress, hauling in $51 million from June 2013 to June 2014, Forbes reported Monday. The stratospheric sum was due in large part to the success of sci-fi thriller Gravity, which drew $716 million at the box office.

Salaries for the world's highest paid film actors currently range from $20–30 million, but an actor can earn substantially more by deferring all or part of their salary against a percentage of the film's gross, known within the industry as a profit participation deal.
Compare the highest-paid actresses of Hollywood to Forbes world's most powerful celebrities list, of which there are six women in the top 10, Jolie moves much further down to number 41.

10 photos: Forbes: highest paid actresses in 2013. 3. Kristen Stewart – Kristen Stewart was top of the list last year but with the Twilight films completed, Stewart's earnings of $22 million mean she has dropped to third.
Gravity star Sandra Bullock is the highest-paid actress in Hollywood, at least from between June 2013 and June 2014, according to Forbes.

10 photos: Forbes: highest paid actresses in 2013. 10. Julia Roberts – Julia Roberts only made one film last year but the other Snow White remake, Mirror Mirror helped landed the well-known superstar on the recent Forbes list with earnings of $10 million.
